content.question: Iwasaki’s position in the letter on the relationship between the Mitsubishi Company and the Japanese government is most clearly a response to

choices.label: Western governments gaining access to Japan’s markets by imposing laissez-faire economic regimes
Japan’s policy of strict economic isolation and restricting cultural contacts with the West
concerns that Japan’s aggressive economic and foreign policies were jeopardizing relations with its East Asian neighbors
the prospect that the development of domestic shipping might lead to a war between Japan and Western countries

content.answer: Western governments gaining access to Japan’s markets by imposing laissez-faire economic regimes

topic.text: 5.7: Economic Developments and Innovations in the Industrial Age

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
